title: Help please, apparently 'lol_air_client' causes error with my client and browser
body:
To make this brief it feels like at some point after a new LoL patch is released (or at least once a month) I have the following issue:

I open the patcher to play LoL and after clicking 'Launch', nothing happens. The client never loads up.

Now, I'm not asking how to fix this because I simply go to my League folder --> delete 'lol_air_client' folder by going into RADS -> Projects.
I then run League as Administrator, wait for it to patch (takes a while), and then it's fine after that.
I've had this problem pop up several times. (found this fix on an old post on the boards)

**I'm not asking for how to fix my issue since like I said I manage to get it working. 
But how do I fix it permanently?
**
The weird thing is that at the same time this occus, my Google chrome is 'unable to load my profile correctly' (I get a popup message on my browser when I open Chrome).
This stops videos from loading for example, the image in the video would be loaded but pressing play or pressing pause doesn't make a difference. It just doesn't start. You can skip through the video, it will load up the frame of the minute/second you fastforwarded to, but it doesn't actually play. It just remains at the same frame/spot, whatever you may call it.

Funnily enough this all goes away by simply deleting the 'lol_air_client' folder.
My browser (google chrome) and videos work just fine immediately after deleting said folder.
As for the LoL client, it loads up fine and works again once it's done patching.

I've done this "fix" for quite some time now everytime the problem resurfaces.

My question is: does anyone know _**why **_this happens?

I don't think it's my computer or chrome that causes this, since like I said, both the issues involving my browser and my client not starting is/will be fixed by deleting the folder and patching again.

I don't have any programs installed on my computer that interact with League except Overwolf and LSI, incase anyone is wondering if I have any other programs messing with League folders/files.
From what I understand they don't breach any terms so I don't think they are modifying anything within the League folder surely? Or anyway should be safe to use?

So how come does that folder 'supposedly' cause these issues? 
I say supposedly because I don't know for sure if the folder itself is the reason for the errors or if it's simply the fix. 
I don't have the knowledge to fully believe its the 'lol_air_client' folder doing all of this.
I haven't, and don't, modify anything in the League folders, so why does this happen?
It seemingly happens randomly but usually shortly after a new patch is released.

If it's not the folder itself causing the problem, but it does indeed fix it, what causes it then?
Because to be honest it's becoming really frustrating to have to deal with this often enough.
Also, how can the folder have an impact on if my browser (google chrome) works or not?

If anyone can help me out I'll greatly appreciate this, thank you!

replies.body: I know you may have found a temporary fix here, but I don't recommend modifying files as it can usually end up causing you more trouble.  Reach out to us in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so our tech team can look into this and see what's up.  I also suggest downloading the [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to obtain logs for context.  Attach it to your ticket, and we'll reply asap!
Thank you very much for the fast reply, I'll do so! :)

Ive had this problem for 6ish months, a much faster temp fix is as shown below
- hit launch
- Go into your league folders
- Click Rads
- Click Projects
- lol_air_client
- Releases 
- Click on most recent patch ( The bottom one ) 
- Deploy
- Then click "lol_client" , the one with the blue icon.
